question: How do I apply for this course?
answer: If you are interested in our Full Stack Web Development Course, you can apply here.

question: Who is eligible to apply for this course?
answer: Academic Background - The only academic criterion to apply for this program is that you should have cleared 12th standard or equivalent. No other degree/experience is required for this program.
Proficiency in English - This course is conducted in English, hence you should be able to follow instructions in English.

Full-Time Availability - It is a very intensive course, and requires your full-time commitment. Our Lectures, Practice sessions, Mentoring & discussions sessions run full day from 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM. Also, between 9:00 AM and 6:00 PM, Monday to Friday, you will be engaged with AttainU, however, that’s not all, you will have to put extra time & efforts after 6:00 PM and on weekends too for your self-study and practice.
Available to work after course - The objectives of this course are Learning and Placement, hence you should be available to take a job after completion of this course.

question: What are the logistics required for this course?
answer: Minimum 1 Mbps download speed.

Minimum Computer Hardware Specs -
1 GHz Processor
4 GB RAM
120 GB Hard Drive
Microphone
WebCam

question: What is the selection criteria of this course?
answer: The main thing we assess for in our enrollment process is the efforts a student will be able to put during this course.

question: Tell me about the Enrollment Process?
answer: We have carefully designed our enrollment process to be like a personalized counselling session. Going through it will help you figure out if this course will be useful for you.
Further our enrollment process will also help you develop a coding mindset. This is especially important if you are coming from a completely non-coding background.

question: Do I need to pay or submit any bond/agreement for going through the Enrollment Process?
answer: No, you can go through our enrollment process without paying or submitting anything.
You only have to pay, once you clear the enrollment process and decide to join this course.

question: When will I get the Selection Result?
answer: You’ll automatically get the selection result when you complete the enrollment process.

question: What is an ISA?
answer: ISA is the Income Share Agreement. ISA fundamentally means that you share a part of your income as the course fee i.e. you pay the course fee, once you start earning as a result of the skills you learn in the course.

question: Do I need a guarantor or a confirming party in the ISA agreement?
answer: Yes, as we invest in you throughout the course, to safeguard our investment, we will need a co-applicant/guarantor/confirming party involved, from your side, in the ISA agreement.
This person should be financially independent.
This person will be your guardian throughout the course. From time to time we will also keep them updated on your progress in the course.

question: How does ISA work at AttainU?
answer: According to our ISA, you will pay the tuition fee of Rs. 2,00,000 when you get placed at a salary equal to or more than Rs. 5 Lakhs per annum within 12 months of the completion of the course. You’ll have the option to pay this fee in easy EMIs of upto 24 months.

ISA is a legally binding contract which ensures that all the parties involved in the contract follow all the rules and regulations. It has information, terms & conditions related to your Training, Placement & Income Sharing.
ISA is signed by You, AttainU and your confirming party (guardian).

question: Is there a Registration Fee involved if one chooses the ISA payment option?
answer: Yes, there is a registration fee of Rs. 30,000 (+18% GST).
You only have to pay this registration fee after successfully completing AttainU’s Personalized Enrolment Process.
This registration fee is paid upfront i.e.before the batch starts.
This registration fee is non-refundable.
You can choose to pay the registration fee through any of the payment methods - Debit/Credit Cards, UPI, NetBanking, Online Wallets etc.
This registration fee helps us ensure that only serious students join the batch and the entire batch progresses together with a strong focus on efforts and learning.

question: How does ISA payment collection happen?
answer:
Our ISA payment collection is done in one of the below two ways -

  1) through our NBFC (Non-Banking Financial Company) partners. When you get a job, as per the ISA conditions, our assigned NBFC partner will grant you a zero-interest loan equal to the ISA amount (Rs. 2,00,000) which you can choose to pay in EMIs of 24 months. This option is subject to your co-applicant's credit rating passing the assigned NBFC's criterias.

  2) directly pay AttainU, the ISA amount (Rs. 2,00,000), in EMIs spread over 1 month to 10 months.

question: Can I see a copy of the ISA?
answer: Yes, ofcourse. As you go through our enrolment process, you will be counseled on various aspects of the ISA and a copy of the same will be made available to you at the end.

question: Does the ISA amount include taxes?
answer: Yes, Rs 2 Lakhs is inclusive of GST and other taxes.

question: When do I have to start paying as per the ISA?
answer: You will start paying from the time you get your 1st salary after you join a company paying you 5 LPA or more.

question: How will you verify my income?
answer: As per the ISA, you will be legally bound to furnish all the documents relevant to your Income such as Offer Letter, Salary Slips, Income Tax Returns, Bank Statements etc.

question: Will I have to pay if I quit the job or get fired?
answer: Yes. You will have to keep paying.

Our value proposition is to train you and help you to get your 1st job as a software engineer. At the same time, while doing that, we make sure not to force you to join any particular company. At the end of the day the company you join is based on the company’s and your mutual choice. After that you will have to use your skills to grow in your career.
However, if you do get fired, being an AttainU alumnus, we will try connecting you with our hiring partners for other jobs.

question: Will I have to pay if I change my Job?
answer: Yes. You will have to keep paying.
Our value proposition is to train you and help you to get your 1st job as a software engineer. After that you will have to use your skills to grow in your career.
Being an AttainU alumnus, you will always have the option to find your new job through our hiring partner network.

question: How will the ISA work if I drop before the completion of the course?
answer: We ideally want each of our registered students to succeed. Hence once a batch starts we hate to see anyone leave mid-way. However, we do understand that sometimes circumstances might force you to seek a drop off in the middle of the course. To provide you a comfortable exit in this case we have a drop out policy. The details of the drop out policy are also mentioned in the ISA.
It allows for an easy drop out till 1 month into the course. In this case, your ISA will stand null & void and you would not have to pay any additional fee.
After 1 month, if you drop out, then there is a drop-out fee, varying from Rs 30,000 to 2 Lakhs, depending on the time you drop out at.

question: Will I have to pay if I get a job earning less than 5 LPA?
answer:
No, you don’t have to pay in that case.
However, at the same time, as per the ISA, you are not allowed to take up any job paying less than 5 LPA, in the 12 month period following course completion. You can only do this after taking explicit written permission from AttainU.

question: For how long do I need to pay the EMIs?
answer:
In your ISA, you can choose from the below different EMI options -

  1) 24 months EMI option through AttainU assigned NBFC. This option is subject to your co-applicant's credit rating meeting the assigned NBFC's criterias

  2) Discounted shorter duration EMIs directly to AttainU -
    a) One Shot (20% discount)
    b) 5 months EMI (10% discount)
    c) 10 months EMI (No discount)

question: Can I pay all the ISA payments at Once?
answer: Yes, you will have the option to pay in full, directly to AttainU at a 20% discount.

question: What will happen if I do not pay any EMI?
answer: If you payment collection is happening through AttainU assigned NBFC, missing your EMIs will affect your credit score negatively making it harder for you to get any loan in future. The NBFC assigned to you, will also most likely take legal recourse to get back their loan amount. If you are paying directly to AttainU, there will be a late fee of Rs 100 per day. While we will hate to, but we will have to execute your ISA Breach Recovery Cheque and take legal action if your EMI gets delayed by more than 30 days. In this case your ISA Security Documents will be held by us till the breach is resolved as per the terms mentioned in the ISA.

question: What is an ISA Breach?
answer: An ISA breach happens when you do not follow any of the terms & conditions written in the ISA.

question: What is an ISA Breach Recovery Cheque?
answer:
ISA Breach Recovery Cheque is the Rs. 50,000 cheque which a student has to submit along with their ISA.
This cheque is from the student’s guardian’s (confirming party on the ISA) bank account. This cheque is in the name of our company. This cheque does not have any date written on it.
As you understand, ultimately learning also depends on the efforts a student puts in. This cheque helps us protect some part of our investment, in the case the student does not put in the required efforts. 
This cheque will be executed only in the case a student breaches the ISA.

question: When will my ISA Breach Recovery Cheque be returned?
answer: At the end of the ISA period, a photo of the cancelled cheque will be sent to you. This photo serves as proof that the cheque has been cancelled and can no longer be encashed. We will not be physically sending the cancelled cheque back to you.

question: What are the ISA Security Documents?
answer: ISA Security Documents are your Original 10th and 12th grade Pass Certificates.
These documents will be held by AttainU as per the ISA and will be safely returned to you in the end.
In the worst case scenario, if a student breaches the ISA agreement, holding these documents helps us ensure that the student remains responsive.

question: When will my ISA Security Documents be returned?
answer:
The ISA Security Documents will be returned as per the below timelines -

  1) After getting a job, if a student chooses to pay the course fee through our NBFC partner, then the documents will be returned once the NBFC partner receives the first EMI from the student.

  2)After getting a job, if a student chooses to pay the course fee directly to AttainU, then the documents will be returned once all the EMIs have been paid.

  3)In the worst case if you decide to drop from the course mid way, then the documents will be returned to you after completing the drop out process as per the ISA.

question: To confirm my admission under the ISA payment option which all documents do I need to submit?
answer:
Once selected for the course, to confirm your admission under the  ISA payment option you will need to submit the below documents -

  1)A signed and stamped copy of the Income Share Agreement.

  2)ISA Breach Recovery Cheque.

  3)ISA Security Documents.

question: By when do I need to submit my documents to confirm my admission under the ISA payment option?
answer: These documents need to be submitted before the starting date of the batch.

question: Do I need to courier a hard copy of my documents?
answer: Yes, these documents will have to be physically couriered to us at our communication address.

question: What will happen to my admission if I am not able to submit my documents before the given deadline?
answer: While we are sure that if sent timely, then the documents will reach us before the batch starting date. However, in case the documents don’t reach us before the batch starting date, then your admission will be put on hold and can be cancelled.

question: Will my Registration Fee be refunded if I am not able to submit my documents before the given deadline?
answer: The Registration Fee is non-refundable.

question: What is the Upfront Fee Payment Option?
answer: Upfront Fee Payment Option is where the course fee is fully paid before joining the course.
By going with this option, you will completely skip the ISA as it will not apply for you.

question: How much will I need to pay if I choose the Upfront Fee Payment Option?
answer: Upfront Fee is Rs 1,30,000.
Currently, we are providing a ‘Stay at Home’ discount of Rs. 30,000 to first 10 admissions. After discount, it will be Rs, 1,00,000.

question: Is the Upfront fee refunded, in case a student doesn’t get a job?
answer: No, the upfront fee is non-refundable.
However, since it’s the same course and the same teaching resources, if you choose the upfront fee payment option, your chances of getting a job will remain the same.

question: In which case should I choose the upfront fee payment option?
answer: Upfront fee amount is significantly lesser than the ISA fee amount. Hence, you should ideally choose the upfront fee payment option if you can afford to pay it directly.

question: Can the course be done part-time?
answer: No, this is a full-time course. It requires upto 8 hours of engagement every week day. It should not be done along with any job or any other classes.
Based on our past experience, in all the cases when someone has tried to do this course along with some other thing, they have almost always not been able to cope up with this course.

question: How long is the course going to be?
answer: This is a 36 weeks long course.

question: Is it possible that the course might get extended to more than 36 weeks?
answer: Yes, sometimes depending on the pace of the batch, the course might get extended by a bit.
In the end, we want to make sure that none of our students get left behind. To ensure this we sometimes have to take repeat lectures or slow down the pace of the batch.

question: What certificate will I be given on course completion?
answer: You’ll get a certificate from AttainU when you complete the course.
Note, this certificate will not be AICTE or any college approved.
Our main objective is to ensure that you are an in-demand software engineer by the end of this course.

question: What is the medium of instruction going to be?
answer: Since each batch includes students from all over India, we follow English as the only medium of instruction.
You are expected to be proficient enough in English to be able to understand the course and ask doubts.

question: How will I be evaluated, during the course?
answer: We do monthly skill assessments.
Only the students who score 40% or above move forward with the same batch.
Other students are given a free batch transfer option. This allows them to repeat the material and master the skills before moving ahead.
Our objective here is to make sure that when a student completes the course they have the skills required to bag that job.

question: If I fail in the monthly exam. What will happen next?
answer: You‘ll be given a chance to attend the retest if you are not able to clear it then you‘ll be given the option for free batch transfer.

question: How many times can I take the batch transfer?
answer: 2 times, free of cost

question: When does the Batch Transfer happen?
answer: During the course we follow something known as mastery based progression i.e. students progress to the next month after mastering the concepts from the current month.

Ultimately our objective is to ensure that after the completion of the course you are ready to face interviews and to start your Software Engineering Career. Mastery based progression helps us ensure just that.

Batch Transfer is only applicable for students, who appear in the test and are not able to perform satisfactorily in the same. In case, due to some unforeseen emergency, you are not able to take the test, you must inform us beforehand along with proof, as applicable, to be eligible for batch transfer.

question: If I want to drop out in the middle of the course what will happen?
answer: After confirmation, an invoice will be raised against you according to the dropout policy mentioned in the ISA.

question: How many hours daily lecture will be there?
answer: 2 hours of daily lecture.
Along with that you’ll also have daily homework discussion and doubt resolution sessions with your TAs and Mentors.
You’ll also be given practise homework to master the topics.
Your overall engagement will be for the whole day from 9 am to 7 pm.

question: Is there any project in this course?
answer: Yes there will be projects after the end of every module.

question: Is attendance mandatory as it is an online course?
answer: Yes a minimum of 90% lecture attendance is required to complete this course.
Attending lectures and other sessions allows you to get all your doubts resolved in real time.

question: What is an AMA session?
answer: AMA stands for Ask Me Anything.
Sometimes we conduct AMA sessions with industry leaders and with the AttainU team. This is where you can ask any questions you might have around industry best practises or about this course.

question: If I miss a lecture. How can I cover the topics in that session?
answer: You ll be provided with recorded lecture videos but regular attendance is important.

question: Will the content be available after the completion of the course?
answer: Yes, recorded lecture videos will be uploaded on your university portal and you'll have indefinite access to those.

question: Who will be the faculty for this course?
answer: We select all our faculty very carefully, based on both their technical knowledge as well as content delivery skills.
We have specialized faculty for each module in the course.
All our faculty is regularly rated 4 and above out of 5.

question: When will the placements start, what will be the procedure?
answer: Placements start at the end of the course i.e. after 9 months. Before that you will be required to qualify the Final Placement Ready Test (FPRT).

question: What is FPRT (Final Placement Ready Test)?
answer: At the end of this course a third party (not AttainU) conducts a Final Test based on the course curriculum and students scoring more than 65% are considered eligible for the placement.

question: What if I don’t qualify the FPRT?
answer: No worries, you can reattempt the FPRT after 2-3 weeks once you revise the course material. There is no limit on the number of FPRT attempts.

question: Does AttainU prepare me for the interviews as well ?
answer: Yes, through 7+ workshops based on Resume building, Linkedin, P2P Mock interviews. Checkout the full details of workshops here.

question: How many hiring partners does AttainU have?
answer: AttainU has more than 185+ hiring partners but not all of them are hiring all the time, it works on a rolling basis.

question: Where are these hiring partners based out of?
answer: Majority of our hiring partners are based out of Bangalore, Mumbai, Pune, Hyderabad, Noida, Gurgaon. And some are spread across India.

question: What if I want to get a job only in my hometown which is not mentioned above (Tier II or III cities)?
answer: Given that the average salary of software engineers is very less in Tier II or Tier III cities, this course requires students to be open to relocating to at least 1 of the 6 cities mentioned above. However, when setting up your interviews we will give priority to partners belonging to your hometown.

question: Does AttainU provide any placement support even after my 1st job?
answer: Yes, through regular hiring sessions and a strong alumni base. We assist you in switching jobs even after you get placed.

question: Does AttainU guarantee a job after this course.
answer: No, although AttainU’s course is highly aligned with the market requirement and standards, hard work, efforts and dedication from the student’s side is equally required. If you have learned the course content then you will get a job easily, since the demand for software developers is very high.

question: Is there any specific degree required to sit for placement?
answer: No, based on the performance in the entire 9 months and FPRT percentage you will be eligible for placements.
